explanation: The report is correct. In lfs_rename_ the parameters oldpath and newpath are pointer parameters (const char *). The code takes their addresses and passes &oldpath and &newpath to lfs_dir_find, which advances the pointer (updates the pointer value). That writes to the parameter variables oldpath/newpath themselves. MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 forbids modifying a function parameter variable (the pointer itself); it only allows modifying the object referred to by a pointer parameter, not the pointer value. Thus this is a violation. The wrapper lfs_rename shown initially does not itself violate the rule, but lfs_rename_ does. A compliant fix is to copy the incoming pointers into local variables (e.g. const char *p_old = oldpath; const char *p_new = newpath;) and pass &p_old / &p_new to lfs_dir_find so the parameter variables are not modified.
